project.name: SwishSprite API
project.description: SwishSprite API: HTML5 audio sprite library

cloudkid.AudioUtils.name: cloudkid.AudioUtils
cloudkid.AudioUtils.description: A collection of utilities for detecting the availability of HTML5 audio
cloudkid.AudioUtils.author: Matt Moore <matt@cloudkid.com>

cloudkid.EventDispatcher.name: cloudkid.EventDispatcher
cloudkid.EventDispatcher.description:
The EventDispatcher mirrors the functionality of AS3 and CreateJS's EventDispatcher, 
but is more robust in terms of inputs for the `on()` and `off()` methods.

cloudkid.PageVisibility.name: cloudkid.PageVisibility
cloudkid.PageVisibility.description: Handle the page visiblity change, if supported

params.name: onFocus
params.description: Callback when the page becomes visible

params.name: onBlur
params.description: Callback when the page loses visibility

cloudkid.PageVisibility.author: Matt Moore <matt@cloudkid.com>

cloudkid.SwishSprite.name: cloudkid.SwishSprite
cloudkid.SwishSprite.description:
This class is responsible for playback of an audiosprite 
file (multiple sounds in a single timeline) using HTML5 audio

params.name: data
params.description: The name of the audio file to load, array of resources, or a spritemap

cloudkid.SwishSprite.author: Matt Moore <matt@cloudkid.com>

Debug.name: Debug
Debug.description:
A static closure to provide easy access to the console
without having errors if the console doesn't exist
to use call: Debug.log('Your log here')

namespace.name: namespace
namespace.description:
Static class for namespacing objects and adding
classes to it

classitems.description:
Check if HTML5 Audio is supported in any of the available 
formats. If returns false, we should disable sounds. Modified from modernizr

Keep track of the paused state when the page blur/focuses 
a value of -1 means the page isn't hidden, 0 means the 
playing before blur, and 1 means paused before blur

If using external update call, you can use this to save performance
